Author: Jane Austen
Summary: Read about the societal and romantic entanglements of the Bennet family, particularly the independent and intelligent Elizabeth Bennet, as she navigates the constraints of 19th century English society and falls in love with the proud and wealthy Mr. Darcy.

Author: Nicholas Sparks
Summary: The Notebook ia a romantic drama about a young couple from different social classes, Allie and Noah, who fall deeply in love in the 1940s but are separated by war and Allie's parents, and after several years, they reunite in their old age.

Author: Jane Austen
Summary: Sense and Sensibility is a novel by Jane Austen that follows the romantic entanglements of two sisters, Elinor and Marianne Dashwood, as they navigate societal expectations and personal relationships in late 18th century England

Author: John Green
Summary: The Fault in Our Stars by John Green is a young adult novel that explores the poignant love story between two teenagers with terminal illnesses who embark on a journey of self-discovery, friendship, and acceptance.

Author: Charlotte Bronte
Summary: Jane Eyre is a novel by Charlotte Bronte that tells the story of a young woman's struggles and triumphs as she navigates societal expectations and personal challenges in Victorian England, ultimately finding love and independence.

Author: Sally Thorne
Summary: The Hating Game by Sally Thorne is a contemporary romance novel that follows the witty and competitive banter between two coworkers who initially despise each other but soon find themselves falling in love.

Author: Audrey Niffenegger
Summary: The Time Traveler's Wife by Audrey Niffenegger is a love story about a man with a genetic disorder that causes him to time travel unpredictably and the woman who loves him through the complications and challenges it causes in their relationship.

Author: Nicholas Sparks
Summary: A Walk to Remember by Nicholas Sparks is a poignant romance novel about two high school seniors from vastly different backgrounds who fall in love and learn to confront life's challenges together, ultimately leaving a lasting impact on each other's lives.

Author: Mariana Zapata
Summary: All Rhodes Lead Here by Mariana Zapata is a slow-burn contemporary romance novel about a young woman who moves to a small town in Texas for a job opportunity, where she gradually falls in love with her boss's reserved and grumpy brother.

Author: Nicholas Sparks
Summary: Message in a Bottle by Nicholas Sparks is a romance novel about a young journalist who discovers a mysterious love letter in a bottle and sets out to find its author, leading to a journey of self-discovery and unexpected love

Author: Robert Ludlum
Summary: Jason Bourne, an amnesiac man who must piece together his past while being pursued by various agencies and assassins.

Author: David Ricciardi
Summary: Black Flag Rising follows CIA agent Jake Keller as he races against time to prevent a terrorist attack on the United States while navigating a web of deception and betrayal.

Author: Matthew Quirk
Summary: Framed and on the run for his life, a former Secret Service agent discovers how far some men will go to grasp the highest office in the land

Author: Lee Child
Summary: The Sentinel follows Jack Reacher as he investigates a sinister conspiracy involving a mysterious signal and a powerful private military corporation, and races against time to stop a catastrophic attack on American soil.

Author: Clive Cussler
Summary: Husband-and-wife team Sam and Remi Fargo come up against an old enemy while searching for a treasure that has been lost for centuries

Author: Ian K. Smith
Summary: The Ancient Nine follows a young Harvard student, Spenser Collins, as he attempts to uncover the secrets of a secretive and exclusive society known as the Ancient Nine and uncovers a web of conspiracies and betrayals.

Author: Jack Carr
Summary: The Savage Son follows former Navy SEAL James Reece as he pursues a dangerous terrorist leader through the jungles of South America and confronts his own demons in a quest for revenge and redemption.

Author: Owen Laukkanen
Summary: The Gale Force follows a group of fishermen who turn to smuggling drugs to make ends meet and soon find themselves in over their heads as they are pursued by a ruthless drug lord and a determined coast guard investigator.

Author: Alex Kava
Summary: Desperate Creed is a novel by Alex Kava that follows FBI Special Agent Maggie O'Dell as she investigates a series of deadly explosions in small towns across America and uncovers a conspiracy that threatens the entire nation.

Author: Raymong Khoury
Summary: Empire of Lies is a novel by Raymond Khoury that follows former British intelligence officer Blake Antrim as he uncovers a dangerous conspiracy involving Russian oligarchs, American politicians, and a mysterious energy source with the potential to change the world.

BookTitle: The Lord of the Rings: The Fellowship of the Ring
Author: J.R.R. Tolkein
Summary: The Fellowship of the Ring by J.R.R. Tolkien is a high fantasy novel about a hobbit named Frodo Baggins who embarks on a perilous quest to destroy a powerful ring that could enslave the world with the help of a diverse group of allies.

Author: Patrick Rothfuss
Summary: The Name of the Wind by Patrick Rothfuss is a high fantasy novel about a legendary wizard named Kvothe who recounts his extraordinary life story, including his time as a student at a prestigious university and his quest for vengeance against a dark force that destroyed his family.

Author: Rick Riordan
Summary: The Lightning Thief by Rick Riordan is a young adult fantasy novel about a twelve-year-old boy named Percy Jackson who discovers he is a demigod and sets out on a dangerous quest to retrieve a stolen lightning bolt and prevent a war between the gods.

BookTitle: Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone
Author: J.K. Rowling
Summary: Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone by J.K. Rowling is a young adult fantasy novel about an orphaned boy named Harry Potter who discovers he is a wizard and attends Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry, where he must confront the evil Lord Voldemort who killed his parents.

BookTitle: A Game of Thrones: A song of Ice and Fire
Author: Georfer R.R. Martin
Summary: A Game of Thrones by George R.R. Martin is a fantasy novel that follows the epic power struggles and political intrigue of several noble families vying for control of the Seven Kingdoms of Westeros, while a mysterious threat from beyond the Wall threatens the realm.

Author: Gail Carson Levine
Summary: Ella Enchanted by Gail Carson Levine is a children's fantasy novel that puts a unique twist on the Cinderella story, as a young girl named Ella is cursed with obedience and must find a way to break the spell while navigating the challenges of love, friendship, and political intrigue.

Author: David Eddings
Summary: After a long spell of exile, Sparhawk, Pandion Knight and the Queen's champion returns to native land to find it overrun with evil and intrigue - and his young queen greviously ill. Indeed, Ehlana lies magically entombed within a block of crystal, doomed to die unless a cure can be found within a year.

BookTitle: The Way of Kings: Ancient Wisdom for the Modern Man
Author: Brandon Sanderson
Summary: The Way of Kings by Brandon Sanderson is an epic high fantasy novel that follows the stories of several characters in a world plagued by devastating storms and conflicts between kingdoms, as they each strive to find their place in a changing world and uncover the truth about their pasts.

Author: Neil Gaiman
Summary: American Gods by Neil Gaiman is a dark fantasy novel about a recently released ex-convict named Shadow who becomes embroiled in a conflict between old gods and new gods in America, and must navigate a dangerous and unpredictable world of myth and magic.

Author: Christopher Paolini
Summary: Eragon by Christopher Paolini is a young adult fantasy novel about a farm boy named Eragon who discovers a dragon egg and becomes embroiled in a quest to overthrow a corrupt king and restore justice to his land.

Author: Orson Scott Card
Summary: Ender's Game by Orson Scott Card is a science fiction novel about a young boy named Ender Wiggin who is trained to become a military commander and must lead his troops in a war against an alien race known as the Formics.

Author: Veronica Roth
Summary: Divergent is a dystopian novel by Veronica Roth that follows a young woman who discovers she doesn't fit into any of the society's predetermined factions and becomes involved in a rebellion against the system

Author: H.G. Wells
Summary: The Time Machine by H.G. Wells is a science fiction novella about a man who invents a machine that allows him to travel through time and witness the future of humanity, encountering both wonder and horror in his journey.

Author: Ray Bradbury
Summary: Fahrenheit 451 by Ray Bradbury is a dystopian novel set in a future society where books are banned and firemen burn any that are found, and follows the journey of a fireman named Guy Montag who begins to question his beliefs and rebel against the oppressive regime.

Author: Mary Shelley
Summary: Frankenstein by Mary Shelley is a gothic novel about a scientist named Victor Frankenstein who creates a monster in his laboratory and must confront the consequences of his actions as the monster seeks revenge against him and his loved ones.

Author: Frank Herbert
Summary: Dune by Frank Herbert is a science fiction novel set in a distant future where noble houses, religious factions, and powerful entities battle for control of the desert planet Arrakis, home of the valuable spice melange, and follows the journey of Paul Atreides, the young heir to a noble house who becomes a leader of the native Fremen people and sets out to fulfill his destiny.

Author: Isaac Asimov
Summary: I, Robot is a collection of short stories by Isaac Asimov that explore the ethical and practical implications of artificial intelligence in the future.

BookTitle: Journey to the Center of the Earth
Author: Jules Verne
Summary: Journey to the Center of the Earth is a science fiction novel by Jules Verne that follows a group of explorers as they venture deep into the earth's core, encountering various challenges and discoveries along the way.

Author: Madeleine L'Engle
Summary: A Wrinkle in Time is a science fiction novel by Madeleine L'Engle that follows three children as they travel through time and space to rescue the protagonist's father from evil forces threatening the universe

Author: Suzane Collins
Summary: The Hunger Games is a dystopian novel by Suzanne Collins that depicts a post-apocalyptic world where teenagers from different districts are forced to compete in a televised battle to the death

Author: Elie Wiesel
Summary: Night by Elie Wiesel is a memoir that recounts the author's experiences as a Jewish teenager during the Holocaust, including his internment at Auschwitz and Buchenwald concentration camps, and his struggle to survive and retain his humanity in the face of unimaginable horrors.

BookTitle: The Diary of a Young Girl
Author: Anne Frank
Summary: The Diary of a Young Girl is a memoir that chronicles the life of Anne Frank, a Jewish girl who kept a diary while in hiding with her family during the Nazi occupation of the Netherlands, until they were discovered and sent to concentration camps.

Author: Michelle Obama
Summary: Becoming is a memoir by former First Lady Michelle Obama that recounts her life and journey from a working-class family on the South Side of Chicago to becoming a lawyer, mother, and advocate, and eventually the First Lady of the United States, sharing personal anecdotes, insights, and reflections along the way.

Author: Barack Obama
Summary: A Promised Land is a memoir by former President Barack Obama that chronicles his early life, political rise, and first term in office, including insights into his decision-making process, challenges faced, and reflections on leadership, democracy, and the American presidency.

Author: Matthew McConaughey
Summary: Greenlights is a memoir by actor Matthew McConaughey that offers personal anecdotes, reflections, and lessons learned throughout his life and career, with a focus on self-discovery, growth, and living life to the fullest.

Author: Nelson Mandela
Summary: Long Walk to Freedom is an autobiography by former South African President Nelson Mandela that details his early life, activism against apartheid, 27-year imprisonment, and role in the country's transition to democracy.

Author: Malala Yousafzai
Summary: I Am Malala is a memoir by Nobel Peace Prize laureate Malala Yousafzai that recounts her experiences growing up in Pakistan, speaking out for girls' education, and surviving an assassination attempt by the Taliban, and her continued advocacy and activism for women's rights and education.

Author: Yusra Mardini
Summary: Butterfly is a memoir by actress and model, Yusra Mardini, that details her life as a Syrian refugee, her harrowing journey to escape the war in Syria, and her rise to international acclaim as an Olympic swimmer.

Author: Adam Kay
Summary: This Is Going to Hurt is a memoir by British doctor Adam Kay that provides a humorous and poignant insight into the challenges, triumphs, and absurdities of working in the National Health Service (NHS) in the UK.

BookTitle: I Know Why the Caged Bird Sings
Author: Maya Angelou
Summary: I Know Why the Caged Bird Sings is an autobiography by poet and writer Maya Angelou that recounts her childhood experiences of racism, trauma, and identity, and her journey towards self-discovery, resilience, and creativity.

Author: David Sedaris
Summary: Me Talk Pretty One Day is a collection of essays by comedian and writer David Sedaris that offers humorous and candid observations on his life, family, travels, and struggles to learn French, among other topics.

Author: Trevor Noah
Summary: Born a Crime is a memoir by comedian and TV host Trevor Noah that details his childhood growing up in apartheid-era South Africa, where his mixed-race heritage made him a crime by law, and his journey to become one of the most successful comedians and voices of his generation.

Author: Neil Gaiman
Summary: Good Omens is a novel by Terry Pratchett and Neil Gaiman that tells the comedic story of an angel and a demon who team up to prevent the end of the world, all while dealing with the misadventures of the Antichrist and a cast of eccentric characters.

Author: Allie Brosh
Summary: Hyperbole and a Half is a graphic memoir by Allie Brosh that blends humor and poignant insights into her personal experiences with depression, anxiety, and everyday life.

BookTitle: The Ultimate Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy
Author: Douglas Adams
Summary: The Ultimate Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy is a collection of science fiction novels by author Douglas Adams that follows the adventures of an unwitting human named Arthur Dent, who travels through space with an alien friend and a Hitchhiker's Guide to survive and unravel the mysteries of the universe.

Author: Steve Martin
Summary: Born Standing Up is a memoir by comedian Steve Martin that chronicles his early years as a performer, his development of his unique brand of comedy, and the struggles and sacrifices he made in pursuit of his dream of becoming a successful stand-up comedian.

Author: Norm McDonald
Summary: Based on a True Story is a memoir by comedian Norm Macdonald that blends humorous anecdotes, reflections on his career in comedy and television, and personal insights into his struggles with addiction and his unique perspective on life.

BookTitle: We are Never Meeting in Real Life
Author: Samantha Irby
Summary: We Are Never Meeting in Real Life is a collection of essays by Samantha Irby that explores her personal experiences and observations on topics such as relationships, family, race, health, and pop culture, with her signature mix of wit, honesty, and humor.

BookTitle: Fear and Loathing in Las Vegas
Author: Hunter D. Thompson
Summary: Fear and Loathing in Las Vegas is a novel by Hunter S. Thompson that follows the drug-fueled journey of journalist Raoul Duke and his attorney Dr. Gonzo as they travel to Las Vegas to cover a motorcycle race and engage in a series of psychedelic misadventures that reflect the counterculture of the 1960s.

Author: J.D. Salinger
Summary: The Catcher in the Rye is a novel by J.D. Salinger that follows the story of Holden Caulfield, a troubled teenager who is expelled from his prep school and wanders the streets of New York City while grappling with themes of alienation, identity, and the loss of innocence.

Author: Steven D. Levitt, Stephen J. Dubner
Summary: Freakonomics is a book that uses economic theories and data analysis to explore unconventional topics and uncover surprising insights about the world.

Author: David Goggins
Summary: Never Finished offers a candid and inspiring account of entrepreneurship, personal growth, and the power of resilience in the face of setbacks and failures.

Author: Walter Issacson
Summary: The Steve Jobs book provides an in-depth look at the life, career, and visionary ideas of the innovative co-founder of Apple Inc.

Author: Jennette McCurdy
Summary: I'm Glad My Mom Died is a book that explores the complex emotions and psychological effects of growing up with an abusive and neglectful mother, and how the author found healing and hope through forgiveness and self-discovery.

Author: Eddie Jaku
Summary: The Happiest Man on Earth is a book that recounts the inspiring and heartbreaking story of a Holocaust survivor who finds joy and meaning in life despite enduring unimaginable trauma and loss.

Author: Siddhartha Mukerjee
Summary: The Emperor of All Maladies is a comprehensive and gripping history of cancer, from its earliest documented cases to the latest scientific breakthroughs in diagnosis and treatment.

Author: Imani Perry
Summary: South to America is a novel that follows the author's journey as an undocumented immigrant from Guatemala to the United States, facing numerous challenges and obstacles along the way.

Author: Keaton Beaton
Summary: Ducks by Kate Beaton is a humorous and heartwarming book that follows the misadventures of a group of ducks as they explore the world around them.

Author: Jonathan Freedland
Summary: Escape Artist is a book that chronicles the fascinating life and career of Harry Houdini, the world-renowned magician and escape artist who captivated audiences with his death-defying stunts and illusions.

Author: Adel Sedra, Kedra Smith
Summary: Microelectronic Circuits is a textbook by Adel Sedra and Kenneth C. Smith that provides a comprehensive introduction to the principles, design, analysis, and applications of microelectronic circuits, with a focus on digital and analog circuits and their integration on a chip.

Author: Khaled Hosseini
Summary: The Kite Runner is a novel that tells the powerful story of a young boy in Afghanistan and his journey to redemption after betraying his best friend during a traumatic event.

Author: Markus Zusak
Summary: The Book Thief is a historical fiction novel set in Nazi Germany that tells the heart-wrenching story of a young girl named Liesel who finds solace and refuge in books during a time of war and oppression.

Author: Louisa May Alcott
Summary: Little Women is a classic novel that follows the lives and struggles of the four March sisters as they navigate growing up, finding love, and facing the challenges of poverty and societal expectations in 19th century New England.

Author: Diana Gabaldon
Summary: Outlander is a historical fiction novel that blends romance, adventure, and time-travel as it follows the story of a married combat nurse from 1945 who is transported back to 1743 Scotland, where she becomes embroiled in political intrigue and a passionate love affair.

BookTitle: All the Light We Cannot See
Author: Anthony Doerr
Summary: All the Light We Cannot See is a Pulitzer Prize-winning novel that tells the intertwined stories of a blind French girl and a German boy during World War II, as they navigate the horrors of the war and strive to preserve their humanity and compassion amidst the chaos.

Author: Kristin Hannah
Summary: The Nightingale is a historical fiction novel set in Nazi-occupied France that follows the story of two sisters who join the French Resistance and risk their lives to save Jewish children and allied pilots.

Author: Kathryn Stockett
Summary: The Help is a novel that explores racial inequality and segregation in 1960s Mississippi through the perspectives of three women - two black maids and a white woman - who challenge the status quo and fight for justice and equality.

BookTitle: A Gentleman in Moscow: A Novel
Author: Amor Towles
Summary: A Gentleman in Moscow is a novel that tells the story of a Russian aristocrat who is sentenced to house arrest in a luxurious hotel in Moscow during the Bolshevik Revolution, where he navigates the changing political landscape and discovers the power of relationships and human connection.

Author: Heather Morris
Summary: The Tattooist of Auschwitz is a historical fiction novel based on the true story of a Slovakian Jew who is imprisoned in Auschwitz concentration camp during World War II and becomes the tattooist tasked with marking prisoners with their identification numbers, before falling in love with a fellow prisoner.

Author: Margaret Mitchell
Summary: Gone with the Wind is a classic novel set in the American South during the Civil War and Reconstruction era, that tells the story of Scarlett O'Hara, a strong-willed and complex protagonist who navigates the challenges of love, loss, and survival in a changing society.

Author: Agatha Christie
Summary: And Then There Were None by Agatha Christie is a classic mystery novel that follows ten strangers who are invited to a remote island only to find themselves trapped and targeted by an unknown killer, forcing them to confront their own guilt and past crimes in a deadly game of survival.

Author: Maureen Johnson
Summary: Truly Devious is a young adult mystery novel that follows a teenage sleuth as she investigates a cold case involving a murder and a kidnapping at a prestigious boarding school.

Author: Ellen Raskin
Summary: The Westing Game is a mystery novel that follows sixteen people who are invited to live in a luxurious apartment building owned by the eccentric Samuel Westing, and compete in a game to inherit his fortune, as they navigate clues and work together to solve the mystery of his death.

BookTitle: The Girl with the Dragon Tattoo
Author: Steig Larson
Summary: The Girl with the Dragon Tattoo is a crime thriller novel that follows an investigative journalist and a troubled young computer hacker as they team up to solve a decades-old disappearance case, and uncover a complex web of corruption and violence in the process.

Author: Dan Brown
Summary: The Da Vinci Code is a mystery novel that follows symbologist Robert Langdon and cryptologist Sophie Neveu as they unravel a conspiracy involving a secret society, the Catholic Church, and the true identity of Mary Magdalene, while being pursued by an assassin.

Author: Delia Owens
Summary: Where the Crawdads Sing is a coming-of-age novel and murder mystery that follows a young girl named Kya Clark, who grows up isolated in the marshes of North Carolina, as she navigates relationships, survival, and the investigation into the death of a local man.

Author: Gillian Flynn
Summary: Gone Girl is a psychological thriller novel that follows a couple whose marriage is falling apart, and the wife's sudden disappearance, which leads to a twisted and suspenseful investigation.

Author: Dennis Lehane
Summary: Shutter Island is a psychological thriller novel that follows U.S. Marshals Teddy Daniels and Chuck Aule as they investigate the disappearance of a patient from a maximum-security hospital for the criminally insane, and unravel a complex conspiracy and mind-bending mystery.

Author: Karen McManus
Summary: One of Us Is Lying is a young adult mystery novel that follows four high school students who become suspects in the murder of their classmate, a popular student who dies under mysterious circumstances during detention, as they navigate their secrets and work together to uncover the truth.

Author: Carlene O'Connor
Summary: Murder at an Irish Bakery is a cozy mystery novel that follows Siobhan O'Sullivan, the youngest of six siblings in a large Irish family who run a bakery and cafe in a small village, as she investigates the murder of a local man and uncovers secrets and motives in the tight-knit community.

Author: Arthur Conan Doyle
Summary: The Hound of the Baskervilles by Arthur Conan Doyle is a classic detective novel featuring Sherlock Holmes and Dr. Watson as they investigate a supernatural curse that haunts the Baskerville family on the moors of Devonshire.

Author: E. Lockhart
Summary: We Were Liars by E. Lockhart is a young adult novel that follows the story of a wealthy and privileged family and their secrets, as told through the unreliable narration of a teenage girl struggling to uncover the truth about a tragic incident that occurred on their private island.

Author: Stephen King
Summary: The Shining by Stephen King is a horror novel that follows a struggling writer and his family as they become the caretakers of a remote and haunted hotel, where supernatural forces begin to unravel their sanity and threaten their lives.

Author: Josh Mallerman
Summary: Bird Box by Josh Malerman is a horror novel that follows the story of a woman and her two children who must navigate a post-apocalyptic world where sight is lethal and stay blindfolded to survive a mysterious force that causes people to go insane and commit suicide when they see it.

Author: Edgar Allen Poe
Summary: The Tell-Tale Heart is a short story by Edgar Allan Poe that follows an unnamed narrator who becomes obsessed with the pale blue eye of an old man and ultimately murders him, driven to madness by the sound of the victim's beating heart beneath the floorboards.

Author: Thomas Harris
Summary: The Silence of the Lambs by Thomas Harris is a psychological thriller novel that follows a young FBI agent named Clarice Starling as she enlists the help of the incarcerated and manipulative cannibalistic psychiatrist, Dr. Hannibal Lecter, to track down a serial killer known as Buffalo Bill.

Author: Bram Stoker
Summary: Dracula by Bram Stoker is a classic horror novel that follows the story of a young lawyer named Jonathan Harker and his friends as they attempt to defeat the infamous vampire Count Dracula, who threatens to spread his curse of the undead throughout Victorian England.

Author: Truman Capote
Summary: As Truman Capote reconstructs the murder and the investigation that led to the capture, trial, and execution of the killers, he generates both mesmerizing suspense and astonishing empathy.

Author: William Faulkner
Summary: As I Lay Dying by William Faulkner is a modernist novel that follows the journey of the Bundren family as they transport the body of their deceased matriarch, Addie, to her desired burial place, showcasing the different perspectives and motivations of each family member and the hardships they face along the way.

Author: William Golding
Summary: Lord of the Flies by William Golding is a classic allegorical novel that follows a group of British boys stranded on a deserted island who, in their attempt to establish order and survival, succumb to their primal instincts and engage in violence, revealing the darker aspects of human nature.
